text:
Hi, this is Kate from MinuteEarth - and our corner 
of the cosmos is getting a little less minute;

we have three new additions to the MinuteUniverse 
that we’re excited to share with you.

The first is MinuteFood, a new channel all about 
the science of deliciousness. Every week or two,

I’ll take you into my own kitchen and use 
science to answer all sorts of culinary queries,

like “Why does garlic sometimes taste SO strong?” 
“What is tofu, and how do I cook it?” and “How the

heck does a microwave actually work?”
Then, there’s MinuteMinis,

a new shorts channel featuring highlights from 
all the Minute channels, along with original

minis about everything from frozen frogs to space 
photography to supervolcanoes. MinuteMinis finally

gives you what you’ve been wanting for years: 
Minute videos that are actually a minute long.

And finally, after frustratingly limited 
availability due to supply-chain problems,

the MinuteEarth Explains book is now available 
in online bookstores all around the world.

Now you can hold our gorgeous illustrations 
in your hand and physically flip through

two dozen of our favorite stories about the 
amazing science that happens all around us.

All these new projects are, of course, in 
addition to the amazing stuff that’s already

in our planetary system: MinutePhysics, where 
you’ll find all sorts of fascinating physics

explainers - and, well, Henry - and MinuteLabs, 
the home of Jasper’s fun science interactives.

So, just like the real universe, the 
MinuteUniverse is expanding - and we’re

sure you’re going to have a blast exploring 
it all. Click below to subscribe to MinuteFood

and MinuteMinis - and to grab a copy of 
our new book…it’ll just take a minute.
